title: Bösendorfer piano logo
content:
Can anyone ID the font for this piano company… Bosendorfer

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bosendorfer.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071122220600/http:/typophile.com/files/bosendorfer_0.jpg) | 13.74 KB |

 [‹ Strawberry Shortcake script](http://web.archive.org/web/20071122220600/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15636 "Go to previous forum topic") [Liz Claiborne ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071122220600/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15617 "Go to next forum topic")
author: evan

comments.content: I would rather classify that as a Textura/Gothic, not a Fraktur (quadratic ’serifs’, form of sc ’o’, ’ö’, ’r’). I think I have seen this logo in an ad in a telephone book of Vienna 1924, so it is probably hard to find their ’font’ (if it is not custom, which I could imagine, sure based on letterforms). Their [website](http://web.archive.org/web/20071122220600/http:/www.boesendorfer.com/) does not give any hints on the logo or since when it is in use. Perhaps they can help you if you ask politely?
